intro: Ervatamia corymbosa var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy vervain, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, two-lipped flowers that are typically violet or blue in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
